mainPage.title: Patchwork Creations
mainPage.subtitle: by Ivanete de Mesquita Orsi Vieira
mainPage.aboutParagraph: Inspired by my mother, I became interested and learned some handcrafts from an early age. Looking for new ways to express manual arts, I discovered patchwork in 2005 and fell in love. Since so, I dedicated myself to learning and improving more and more this art.

aboutPage.title: About me
aboutPage.paragraph: My relationship with handcrafts comes from when I was a child when I watched my mother sew, embroider, and crochet. I was always interested and learned from her to admire this art. The handcraft is an opportunity to carry out a way of working without intermediaries, from start to finish. I learned patchwork in 2005 through an instructor who learned this art in France, and I soon fell in love. In addition, any craft activity involves us, connects us, and occupies our minds, making our existential problems lighter. Currently, already retired, I spend my time alternating domestic, cultural, reading, and craft activities.
